insights.title: 2026: The Year CCP-Labeled Credits Finally Scale
insights.excerpt: After two years of framework building, CCP-labeled carbon credit supply is set to surge in 2026. With 30+ methodologies now approved and major programs transitioning to new standards, institutional buyers finally have the volume they've been waiting for.

insights.title: ICVCM Approves Biochar and IFM Methodologies
insights.excerpt: Five new methodologies for biochar and improved forest management now carry CCP approval. Over 500,000 biochar credits projected for 2026 as the removal credit market matures.

insights.title: EU Directive Bans Generic Climate Claims
insights.excerpt: The Empowering Consumers Directive enters force September 2026. Corporate buyers face a clear choice: CCP-aligned credits or regulatory risk. Generic offsetting claims will no longer pass muster.

insights.title: Renewable Energy Credits Excluded from CCP Label
insights.excerpt: Eight renewable energy methodologies—representing 32% of the voluntary carbon market—fail ICVCM additionality requirements. A clear two-tier market is emerging.

insights.title: Colombia's Orinoquia Attracts $100M+ Investment
insights.excerpt: Trafigura and GenZero committed $100M to Brújula Verde, signaling institutional confidence in Colombian forestry assets. The Orinoquia region continues to draw major capital.

insights.title: NBS Removal Demand to Exceed Supply
insights.excerpt: BCG projects a 60 megaton annual shortfall in nature-based removal credits by 2030. Premium IFM credits already command 250% higher prices than avoidance credits.
